updated_cases.title: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with SAML authentication
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with SAML authentication
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set SAML authentication in Forward Proxy page
2. Set SAML access method to all 
3. Using predefin testing okta account to do the authentication
3. Set a SSL decrypt policy with facebook domain
4. Sending traffic will access facebook
5. A authentication pages should pop up.
7. After login, facebook should be accessed
8. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action:
x-action-reason: 
x-policy-action: 
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: Decrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: ???
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Allow
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to block
and SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to block
and SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to block traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Set a SSL not decrypt policy with facebook domain
3. Sending traffic will access facebook
4. Traffic should be blocked
5. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action:
x-action-reason:
x-policy-action: block
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: DoNotDecrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: policy
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: block
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to allow
and SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to allow
and SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to allow traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Set a SSL not decrypt t policy with facebook domain
3. Sending traffic will access facebook
4. Traffic should be allowed
5. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result"
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action:
x-action-reason:
x-policy-action: allow
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: DoNotDecrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: X
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: bypass
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with default RTP policy allow
and SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with default RTP policy allow
and SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Removed all the others RTP Policy
2. Set a SSL not decrypt policy with facebook domain
3. Sending traffic will access facebook
4. Since non of the policy match, apply the default policy action which is to "Allow".
5. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action:
x-action-reason:
x-policy-action: allow_default
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: DoNotDecrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: X
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: bypass
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will proceed while SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will proceed while SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to alert traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Adding User notification template here to make sure user can proceed
3. Set a SSL not decrypt policy with facebook domain
4. Sending traffic will access facebook
5. A notification should pop up when traffic is landing on proxy
6. User press "proceed" button and facebook should be accessed
7. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action:
x-action-reason: 
x-policy-action: useralert
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: DoNotDecrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: policy(default to block)
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Block
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will cancel while SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and user will cancel while SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to alert traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Adding User notification template here to make sure user can cancel
3. Set a SSL not decrypt policy with facebook domain
4. Sending traffic will access facebook
5. A notification should pop up when traffic is landing on proxy
6. User press "cancel" button and facebook should not be accessed
7. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action:
x-action-reason: 
x-policy-action: useralert
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: DoNotDecrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: policy
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Block
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>

updated_cases.title:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and timeout while SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Transaction Event with x-action and x-action-reason with RTP action set to alert
and timeout while SSL not Decrypt
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set a RTP policy to alert traffic of www.facebook.com
2. Adding User notification template here to make sure user can cancel
3. Set a SSL not decrypt policy with facebook domain
4. Sending traffic will access facebook
5. A notification should pop up when traffic is landing on proxy
6. User do nothing and wait for timeout 
7. facebook should not be accessed
8. TEv4 fields should shown as expected result
updated_cases.custom_expected:
x-action:
x-action-reason: 
x-policy-action: useralert
x-policy-name: ""
x-ssl-policy-action: DoNotDecrypt
x-ssl-policy-name: ""
x-error: policy
x-cs-ssl-engine-action: Block
x-sr-ssl-engine-action: <Orthogonal>
